label: Description
value: Top: a group of tents. Bottom: two standing and a riding Bedouin, all shown from the back. Back of another carrying a bag with his left hand. Top right: two rows of stripes; written beside: "striped / curtain / of tent." Written at left: "arab tents / Bedouin / of Black goats hair".

label: Description
value: Figure of a man shown standing. Lines and inscriptions label the parts of his costume.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on brown paper

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by the Museum
Temple with Semua [present day as-Samu] in the Distance

label: Description
value: The ruins are shown at right, the village in the left middle distance.  The wall of the temple is rather well preserved at a corner, with pilasters formed by blocks projecting from it.  A European woman is shown seated upon steps and reading.  A native with a gun crouches in the central foreground.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray paper

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of a group of trees in autumn color stands in center middle ground.  Behind, a low hill sloping up to the right.  Remains of a fence, barely visible at bottom of hill in lower left quadrant; tracks from a cart (?) visible at top of hill in lower right quadrant.  Ground color exposed in margins on all four sides.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil paint, graphite traces on heavy paperboard
Upper Aletsch Glacier with the Great Fusshorn

label: Description
value: Horizontal study of the Aletsch Glacier across two sheets of paper (-a & -b). The sheet shows roughly two thirds of the view.  The glacier is in the foreground against a backdrop of mountain slopes, with the high range in the rear. The Fusshorn rises in the left center, and the Rothhorn is in the center of the background.  Notations throughout, including: 2's; Broken with rounded ledges / scattered trees, stones, etc.; Dark; trees; grey / gravel; gravel; Dirty ice; 2 greenish blue / cleal ial [?]; little black / dirt.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on grey-buff paper
Upper Aletsch Glacier with the Great Fusshorn

label: Description
value: Horizontal study of the Aletsch Glacier across two sheets of paper (-a & -b). The sheet shows roughly one third of the view.  The glacier is in the foreground against a backdrop of mountain slopes. Notations throughout, including: Trees; clear / stones in streaks; dirty but light / tolerably / smooth; clear; dirt; grey [?]. Verso: Small sketch with a mound in the rear, inscribed: Great glacier bed / light grey; Ice [?] dirty.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on grey-buff paper

label: Physical description
value: Pencil. White gouache. Light brown paper.

label: Description
value:
Recto: A slope is shown in the left foreground. View from across the foothills and the plain toward a mountain range. Inscribed across scene: snow / yellow / dark brown / brown / rich brown yellow / gold
In ink, bottom left: overlooking / El Arabah / Feb 20th
Verso: At left, a rocky wall partially shaped into columns, a bird flying above. Inscribed across scene: gold / 3 flint color. At right, a rock shaped like the lower part of a column. Written top center: El Yemen.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on grey paper

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value:
Recto: Continuation of the scene represented in -467. The right bank of a valley leading toward the plain beyond is shown in the foreground and middle ground. Two dromedaries are shown on a road. Inscribed: 2 / dark blue / snow / brown / black h… / greener / yellow. 
Bottom right: overlooking / El Arabah / 2 Mt. Hor. 
Verso: Oblique view of a rock wall. Bottom right: El Yemen.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on grey paper

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: A study of a patch of grass and red foliage is presented on the edge of a pond. The foliage is reflected in the water below which fills the foreground. The gray color at lower right is the color of the paint ground the artist applied before beginning the oil sketch.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil paint on paperboard
Urn Tomb, Silk Tomb, and Corinthian Tomb, Petra

label: Description
value: Temple and architectural ruins carved into the hillside, scattered bricks at base, graphite inscriptions throughout.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on green-gray wove paper

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value:
At right, the northeastern rock wall withThe Urn Tomb, Silk Tomb, and Corinthian Tomb at Petra. Hills and mountain ranges in the background. 
Inscribed: 2 / olive, light / creamy / white / warm / grey / reddish / yellow / mixed. Verso: a sketched mountainous landscape. Inscribed: grey

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray paper

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. In a lightly sketched desert setting, two figures stand on either side of a seated dromedary, draping textiles across its back.  A third figure stands to the left of the dromedary, holding a long staff or gun and looking outward towards the viewer.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and ink, graphite on grey green paper

label: Description
value: Vertical view of a wooded slope with a rock at center, trees at top and shrubs growing out of rocks.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray-green paper

label: Description
value: At center, the facade of El Khasneh is visible facing to the left. The architectural elements are flanked at right and left by reddish-brown rock walls. A small patch of blue sky is at upper left corner.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil on thin paperboard

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Temple facade is shown flanked and surrounded by rocks.  Blue sky is visible in the central and right top.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil, graphite on thick paper

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 2017: acquired by Museum
Architectural Details of El Khasneh, Petra

label: Description
value: View of the entire façade with the flanking rocks. Architectural detail at left and capital details at right. Color notation throughout.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on cream paper

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: View of the facade.  The left part of the colonnade is preserved.  A Bedouin and a woman are seated under it and listen to a man standing upon a kind of pulpit erected of stones.  Fragments of the building lie in front of it.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, white and pale green gouache on olive-gray paper
Studies of Gulls, Rocky Coast and Cloudy Sky, Great Manan, Canada

label: Description
value: Horizontal series of sketches, at top left: gulls; at top right: distant view of the coast; at second row: rocks of the coast of Great Manan [thus], a hill range is in the background; and at third row left: cloudy sky over hills.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on light brown paper

label: Description
value: The dromedary (a one-humped camel) kneels, shown in profile turned toward left.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil paint, graphite on cream cardboard

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by Museum
Views of the Basilica and the Temple of Neptune, Paestum, Italy

label: Description
value:
Recto:  Horizontal view showing at top the southwest corner of the Basilica and the sea, and a distant view of the Temple of Neptune and the Basilica seen from the East with a tree in the right foreground and an olive tree, a house, and the old wall in the left foreground.

Verso:  Horizontal view with the Temple of Neptune visible at the right.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on light gray wove paper

label: Description
value: Recto: a piece of wall is shown in the left foreground; verso: a mountain range is show in the distance with an olive tree.
Part Old Wall at Paestum, Olive Trees Growing on It

label: Description
value: View of a part of an old wall with olive trees and mountains in the background.

label: Description
value: A thin strip of land with the Hudson River winding in the center middle distance; hills visible in right distance.  Dark clouds fill the sky except for a thin orange band of light in the left and center distance and patch of blue in upper right corner.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil paint, graphite traces on paperboard

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Rugged hills bordering a watered and wooded valley shown in the foreground, city and gardens shown in the central middle distance. Hill range in the back. Inscribed figures and notations throughout.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on green-gray paper

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Oblique view of the glacier and the banks. Another glacier is shown in the left middle distance. Notations throughout, including: grand; stone grey & Iron red & orange; slaty gravel.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on grey paper
Aletsch Glacier by Moonlight, Bernese Alps, Switzerland

label: Description
value: Sketch of the glacier and the banks in the distance, beyond a sloping mountainside in the foreground.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on light brown paper

label: Description
value: Vertical view of the trunk and lower bough of a coconut palm tree.
Landscape with Trees and a Stream [?], Grand Manan Island, Canada

label: Description
value: Horizontal view showing trees and a broken tree trunk in the foreground,a stream or lake in the middleground, and wookds on the bank.

label: Description
value:
The steep bed of a stream. A: a rocky bank; B: the continuation of the bank in the rear; C: a lateral bank. 
Inscribed in A: gravelly / reddish / red / sandy tint / bluer / grey / vegetation / varied color
Inscribed in B: velvety / soft / yellow / brown 
Inscribed in C: whitish / brown 
Inscribed at the bottom of each: El Yemen

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by the Museum.

value:

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Hilly country with a lake in the right foreground, and a house and barn at left. Clear, yellow sky seen in a stripe on the horizon. Dark clouds reddened at the fringes with some patches of blue. Bottom margin, shiny creamy grounding color.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil, graphite on cardboard

label: Description
value: Oblique view of a hill range across a plain.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil paint, graphite on cardboard

label: Description
value: View of a partially cloud-capped mountain range, across two slopes. The slope in the foreground shows a meadow, trees, and a field. The slope in the middle distance is wooded. Bottom margin shows shiny, creamy grounding color.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil paint, graphite on cardboard

label: Description
value: The street leading to the Franciscan Church and to the gateway to the Court House which are shown in the left middle distance. The roofs of the houses of the quarter west of it are shown in the right foreground and middle distance. The Watzmann rises in the right background, the Schoenfeld Spitze in the central far distance.
Hinter Schönau and Reiteralp Mountains, Bavaria

label: Description
value: Shown at sunrise. The bottom margin shows the creamy grounding color.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil paint, graphite on thin paperboard

label: Description
value: The Acropolis at sunrise shown in the right middle distance.  Columns and houses are shown in the foreground.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil paint, graphite on paperboard

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Over a rough hillside, the Parthenon appears in the right middle ground.  Classical fragments in the left foreground and the Piraeus in the left distance.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil paint, graphite traces on paperboard

label: Description
value: Horizontal distant view of a small snow-covered valley with a copse of trees. A band of  lavender clouds streches across the sky and sun rays project downward.  A pond in the middle distance, amongst the trees, reflects sunlight.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil paint on thin paperboard
